sen.j: 尾関 雅次郎（おぜき まさじろう、天保15年（1844年）？ - 明治25年（1892年）2月28日）は新選組調役兼監察。
sen.e: Masajiro OZEKI (1844 ? - February 28, 1892) was a Shirabeyaku ken Kansatsu (Shinsengumi's organizational post for investigating movements of the opponents and keeping the Shinsengumi members under control) of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: 新選組→the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate)としました。
sen.e: Masajiro OZEKI (1844 ? - February 28, 1892) was a Shirabeyaku ken Kansatsu (Shinsengumi's organizational post for investigating movements of the opponents and keeping the Shinsengumi members under control) of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

Masajiro OZEKI (1844 ? - February 28, 1892) was a Shirabeyaku ken Kansatsu (Shinsengumi's organizational post for investigating movements of the opponents and keeping the Shinsengumi members under control) of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

sen.j: 旗役として行軍の先頭に任された。
sen.e: He was assigned to bear a flag, leading the march.
He was assigned to bear a flag, leading the march.
He was assigned to bear a flag, leading the march.

sen.j: 後に名を尾関泉とする。
sen.e: Later, he called himself Izumi OZEKI (尾関泉).
sen.cmt: 尾関泉→正式な読み方が不明です：Izumi OZEKI (尾関泉)としました。
sen.e: Later, he called himself Izumi OZEKI (尾関泉).
Later, he called himself Izumi OZEKI (尾関泉).

sen.j: 文久三年（1863年）頃に壬生浪士組(新選組)に入隊し八月十八日の政変に参加。
sen.e: Around 1863, he joined Mibu-Roshigumi (Mibu masterless warriors group) (the predecessor of Shinsengumi) and in August of the same year, he took part in the Coup of August 18.
Around 1863, he joined Mibu-Roshigumi (Mibu masterless warriors group) (the predecessor of Shinsengumi) and he took part in the Coup of August 18.
sen.cmt: in August of the same year: Originalに無いため削除しました。
sen.e: Around 1863, he joined Mibu-Roshigumi (Mibu masterless warriors group) (the predecessor of Shinsengumi) and he took part in the Coup of August 18.

sen.j: 池田屋事件には不参加だった。
sen.e: He did not participated in the Ikedaya Incident.
He did not participate in the Ikedaya Incident.
He did not participate in the Ikedaya Incident.

sen.j: 近藤勇に反発した永倉新八、原田左之助らとともに建白書を提出した。
sen.e: He submitted a petition together with other members, who had a backlash toward Isami KONDO, such as Shinpachi NAGAKURA and Sanosuke HARADA.
He submitted a petition together with other members, who had a backlash toward Isami KONDO, such as Shinpachi NAGAKURA and Sanosuke HARADA.
He submitted a petition together with other members, who had a backlash toward Isami KONDO, such as Shinpachi NAGAKURA and Sanosuke HARADA.

sen.j: 鳥羽・伏見の戦いで敗れ、江戸へ帰還し、土方歳三、島田魁、相馬主計らと箱館まで戦い降伏した。
sen.e: After he returned to Edo (present Tokyo), being defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he went over to Hakodate (Hokkaido) with Toshizo HIJIKATA, Kai SHIMADA, Kazue SOMA and others to fight against the opponents but finally he surrendered.

After he returned to Edo (present Tokyo), being defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he went over to Hakodate (Hokkaido) with Toshizo HIJIKATA, Kai SHIMADA, Kazue SOMA and others to fight against the opponents but finally he surrendered.

After he returned to Edo (present Tokyo), being defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he went over to Hakodate (Hokkaido) with Toshizo HIJIKATA, Kai SHIMADA, Kazue SOMA and others to fight against the opponents but finally he surrendered.

sen.j: その後薬王院に収容された。
sen.e: After that, he was detained at Goyakuo-in (後薬王院) Temple.
sen.cmt: 後薬王院→正式な読み方が不明です：Goyakuo-in (後薬王院) Templeとしました。
sen.e: After that, he was detained at Goyakuo-in Temple.
sen.cmt: (後薬王院) を削除しました。
sen.e: After that, he was detained at Goyakuo-in Temple.

sen.j: 明治25年2月28日に出身地の奈良県高取町で死亡。
sen.e: On February 28, 1892, he died in his home town, Takatori-cho, Nara Prefecture.
On February 28, 1892, he died in his home town, Takatori-cho, Nara Prefecture.
On February 28, 1892, he died in his home town, Takatori-cho, Nara Prefecture.
He was aged 49.
He was 49 years old.
sen.cmt: 享年49:表現を変えました。
sen.e: He was 49 years old.
His grave is found at Koun-ji Temple.
His grave is in Koun-ji Temple.
His grave is in Koun-ji Temple.
